text: John Stuart Mill (20 May 1806 â€“ 8 May 1873) was an English philosopher and political economist. He was a classical liberal thinker of the 19th century. He was for utilitarianism, the ethical theory first proposed by his godfather Jeremy Bentham. As a utilitarian, he believed that the good of society as a whole is more important than the pleasure of one or a few individuals. == References == Category:1806 births Category:1873 deaths Category:19th-century English philosophers Category:British economists Category:Members of the British House of Commons for English constituencies Category:Liberal Party (UK) MPs Category:Politicians from London Category:Scientists from London Category:Writers from London
title: John Stuart Mill
